means: 无精打采的，不决断的，不热心的
无精打采地，不决断地，不热心地

sentence.Network_en: Dr. Jonsen seemed a little lackadaisical at times.
sentence.Network_cn: 琼森医生有时候似乎有点懈怠。

sentence.Network_en: There'll be no time to correct lackadaisical driving techniques after trouble develops.
sentence.Network_cn: 等到麻烦显现时再纠正动作迟缓的驾驶技术就来不及了.

sentence.Network_en: His will was sapped and his whole attitude was lackadaisical.
sentence.Network_cn: 心里松懈,身态与神气便吊儿啷当.

PerfectNetExp.abs: SAT-填空题OG - 豆丁网 ... conscientious 本着良心的，负责的 lackadaisical 懒洋洋的无精打采的 onerous 繁重的, 费力的.
GRE单词17-24 - 豆丁网 ... lachrymose 好流泪的 lackadaisical 无精打采的 lackluster 无光泽的.
inveterate 根深蒂固的lackadaisical 没精打采的ramshackle 东倒西歪的
GRE分类词汇记忆2 - 小马过河 ... insipid adj. 乏味的，枯燥的 lackadaisical adj. 无兴趣的；无精打采的 monotone adj. 单调的.

list.abs: The lackadaisical clerk threw my change on the counter ., 那个懒散的店员将我的零钱扔在柜台上.
The lackadaisical clerk threw my change on the counter ., 那个懒散的店员将我的零钱扔在柜台上.
The lackadaisical clerk threw my change on the counter ., 那个懒散的店员将我的零钱扔在柜台上.
cannot help but 不得不the lackadaisical approach 不得力的方法the continuing degeneration of social values 不断贬低的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (also in the sense 'feebly sentimental'): from the archaic interjection lackaday, lackadaisy (see alack) + -ical

entry.tran: 怠惰的；懒洋洋的；不热心的
entry.def: If you say that someone is lackadaisical, you mean that they are rather lazy and do not show much interest or enthusiasm in what they do.

example.ex: Dr. Jonsen seemed a little lackadaisical at times.
example.tran: 琼森医生有时候似乎有点懈怠。

example.ex: ...the lackadaisical attitude of a number of the principal players.
example.tran: 几名主力队员的懒散态度

means.word_mean: 2. idle or indolent especially in a dreamy way;

auth_sentence.content: Homeward bound in a lackadaisical Indian-summer mood.

auth_sentence.content: The album falls at the first hurdle with the lackadaisical "Over".

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The album falls at the first hurdle with the lackadaisical "Over".

auth_sentence.content: He said police often are "lackadaisical" in enforcing complaints about safety from women.
auth_sentence.res_content: He said police often are "lackadaisical" in enforcing complaints about safety from women.
